flashCards.question: What is an Observable?
flashCards.answer: A push-based, lazy collection that emits values over time
flashCards.note: Unlike arrays which are pull-based, Observables push values to subscribers when they're ready
flashCards.info: Observables can emit 0 to infinite values, and can complete or error

flashCards.question: What's the difference between Hot and Cold Observables?
flashCards.answer: Cold: starts fresh for each subscriber. Hot: shared, emissions happen regardless of subscribers
flashCards.note: API calls are typically cold; mouse events are hot
flashCards.info: Use Publish() + RefCount() to convert cold to hot

flashCards.question: What does Map do?
flashCards.answer: Transforms each emitted value by applying a function
flashCards.note: Input: 1,2,3 with Map(x => x*10) → Output: 10,20,30
flashCards.info: Map is synchronous and 1-to-1 (each input produces exactly one output)

flashCards.question: What does FlatMap do?
flashCards.answer: Maps each value to an Observable and merges all outputs
flashCards.note: Use for async operations like API calls
flashCards.info: Keeps ALL inner subscriptions active concurrently

flashCards.question: When should you use Switch instead of FlatMap?
flashCards.answer: When you only care about the latest result (e.g., search)
flashCards.note: Switch cancels the previous inner Observable when new value arrives

flashCards.question: What does Filter do?
flashCards.answer: Only emits values that pass a predicate test
flashCards.note: Input: 1,2,3,4,5 with Filter(x => x > 3) → Output: 4,5
flashCards.info: Values that fail the predicate are silently dropped

flashCards.question: What does Take do?
flashCards.answer: Emits only the first N items, then completes
flashCards.note: Take(3) on stream 1,2,3,4,5 → 1,2,3 then complete
flashCards.info: Useful for limiting infinite streams or getting first N results

flashCards.question: What does TakeUntil do?
flashCards.answer: Emits values until a notifier Observable emits
flashCards.note: Perfect for cleanup: stream.takeUntil(destroy$)
flashCards.info: Completes when notifier emits, disposing inner subscription

flashCards.question: What does Debounce do?
flashCards.answer: Emits only after a quiet period with no new emissions
flashCards.note: debounce(300ms) waits 300ms after last keystroke

flashCards.question: What does Distinct do?
flashCards.answer: Suppresses duplicate items
flashCards.note: Input: 1,1,2,2,3,1 → Output: 1,2,3 (first 1 only)

flashCards.question: What does Merge do?
flashCards.answer: Combines multiple Observables by interleaving emissions
flashCards.note: Emissions arrive as they happen from any source

flashCards.question: What does Concat do?
flashCards.answer: Emits from streams sequentially (waits for complete)
flashCards.note: Second stream only starts after first completes

flashCards.question: What does CombineLatest do?
flashCards.answer: Combines latest values from multiple sources when any emits
flashCards.note: Requires all sources to emit at least once before first output
flashCards.info: Great for form validation, derived state

flashCards.question: What does Zip do?
flashCards.answer: Pairs values from sources by index (1-to-1)
flashCards.info: Waits for matching pair from each source

flashCards.question: What does Catch do?
flashCards.answer: Recovers from errors by returning fallback
flashCards.note: Can return default value or switch to fallback stream
flashCards.info: Stream continues instead of terminating on error

flashCards.question: What does Retry do?
flashCards.answer: Resubscribes to source on error
flashCards.note: Retry(3) attempts up to 3 times before propagating error

flashCards.question: What does Scan do?
flashCards.answer: Like Reduce but emits each intermediate accumulation
flashCards.note: Input: 1,2,3 with Scan(sum) → Output: 1,3,6
flashCards.info: Perfect for running totals, state management

flashCards.question: What does Reduce do?
flashCards.answer: Accumulates all values and emits only the final result
flashCards.note: Input: 1,2,3 with Reduce(sum) → Output: 6 (on complete)

flashCards.question: What does Buffer do?
flashCards.answer: Collects emissions into arrays/bundles
flashCards.note: Buffer(3) collects into arrays of 3 items
flashCards.info: Can buffer by count, time, or boundary signal

flashCards.question: What does Delay do?
flashCards.answer: Shifts all emissions forward in time
flashCards.note: Delay(500ms) delays each emission by 500ms

flashCards.question: What does Publish do?
flashCards.answer: Converts to ConnectableObservable for multicasting
flashCards.note: Must call Connect() to start emissions
flashCards.info: Allows multiple subscribers to share one subscription

flashCards.question: What does RefCount do?
flashCards.answer: Auto-connects on first subscriber, disconnects on last
flashCards.note: Makes ConnectableObservable behave like regular Observable

flashCards.question: What does Replay do?
flashCards.answer: Caches emissions and replays to late subscribers
flashCards.note: Replay(1) caches last value for new subscribers

flashCards.question: What does Just do?
flashCards.answer: Creates Observable that emits a single value and completes
flashCards.note: Just(42) emits 42 then completes

flashCards.question: What does From do?
flashCards.answer: Converts array/iterable to Observable
flashCards.note: From([1,2,3]) emits 1, 2, 3 then completes

flashCards.question: What does Interval do?
flashCards.answer: Emits sequential integers at time intervals
flashCards.note: Interval(1s) emits 0, 1, 2, 3... every second

flashCards.question: What does Timer do?
flashCards.answer: Emits single value after delay, then completes
flashCards.note: Timer(2s) waits 2 seconds, emits 0, completes
flashCards.info: Can also create infinite sequence after delay

flashCards.question: What does Defer do?
flashCards.answer: Creates fresh Observable for each subscriber
flashCards.note: Factory function called on each subscribe
flashCards.info: Useful for lazy initialization with fresh state

flashCards.question: What does Empty do?
flashCards.answer: Emits no items and completes immediately
flashCards.note: Empty() → complete (no values)
flashCards.info: Useful as fallback or for completion signals

flashCards.question: What does Timeout do?
flashCards.answer: Errors if no emission within specified time
flashCards.note: Timeout(5s) throws if silent for 5 seconds

flashCards.question: What does All do?
flashCards.answer: Checks if all items satisfy a condition
flashCards.note: Emits true if ALL items pass, false on first failure

flashCards.question: What does Contains do?
flashCards.answer: Checks if Observable emits a specific value
flashCards.note: Emits true when value found, false on complete

flashCards.question: What does DefaultIfEmpty do?
flashCards.answer: Emits default value if source completes empty
flashCards.note: Only emits default if NO values emitted

flashCards.question: What does Amb do?
flashCards.answer: Mirrors the first Observable to emit
flashCards.note: All others are unsubscribed

flashCards.question: What's the cleanup pattern with TakeUntil?
flashCards.answer: stream.takeUntil(destroy$) + destroy$.next() on cleanup
flashCards.note: Create destroy$ Subject, emit on component destroy
